page.title: 05Costessey Junior School
page.content: The school is on Three Mile Lane, which is so called because it is next to the milepost three miles from St Benedict's Gate, Norwich. Children aged 7 to 11 years attend the school, from Costessey; there is a bus to bring children from Old Costessey. Children who live at Easton, the first village along the A47 to the west, come to Costessey Junior when they are 8, in the second year. They also come by bus. A small number of children come from other places, like Bawburgh, Honingham and Bowthorpe, because their parents choose to send them to Costessey Junior School.
